summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City of Dallas is holding a public meeting on January 13, 2025, at 10:00 A.M. in the L1FN Auditorium at Dallas City Hall. The meeting aims to engage the Senior Affairs Commission (SAC) in a listening session regarding the Senior Services Strategic Plan, facilitated by consultants from Guidehouse, Inc. and CoSpero Consulting.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Call to Order by Chair Peter Kline.
2. Public speakers will provide input on the Senior Services Strategic Plan.
3. Presentation by consultants on the progress of the strategic plan, including targeted questions to gather insights from the Commission regarding community needs for aging services.

**Important Details**:  
The consultants involved in the presentation include Lance Robertson, Richard Hanely, Claudia Sandoval, and Jay Wright from Guidehouse, Inc., and Tony Moten, Jr. and Madeline Holler from CoSpero Consulting. The session will focus on understanding the evolving needs of the community related to senior services.

**Action Items**:  
The meeting seeks to gather feedback from the Senior Affairs Commission to inform the ongoing development of the Senior Services Strategic Plan. No formal decisions or approvals are expected during this session, but the insights gathered will be crucial for shaping future policies and initiatives related to senior services in Dallas. 

Participants wishing to speak must register 24 hours in advance, and accommodations are available for those needing assistance to participate fully.
